newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine's Kuchma appoints new oil and gas chief.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine's Kuchma appoints new oil and gas chief.

text.p: Ukrainian President Leonid Kuchma has appointed a new head of the State Oil and Gas Committee, filling the top energy post which has been empty since April, the head of the president's staff said on Wednesday.

Yevhen Kushnaryov told a news briefing that Mykhailo Kovalko, 53, had been appointed by presidential decree. Kovalko, whose last position was as head of the state energy-saving body, headed the Oil and Gas Committee from 1992-1994.
Kuchma signed a decree removing Bohdan Babiy from the post in April.

Kovalko will become the fifth head of the Committee in six years of independence from Moscow and some experts blame the frequent changes for a lack of reforms in Ukraine's energy sector and a recent fall in domestic oil and gas output.
